I want to tell you
 My head is filled with things to say

These lines, and this song, were famously quoted in chapter four of David Foster Wallace’s Infinite Jest, who was a fan of the Beatles' and their contributions to popular culture.  An interesting connection between the Baby Boomer Generation and Generation X, Infinite Jest is full of references like this.  “Why did DFW include this in Infinite Jest?”, one might ask?  Like most of his references, and the plot of the book, there is often no specific reason or logic to his Beatles reference in this instance… it was simply something he was thinking of while he wrote the chapter, which makes the book very “po-mo”, as he would say.
I’ll make you maybe next time around

Considering the reference to “games” earlier, this lyric could ironically mean the narrator will later force their conversation partner into arriving at the necessary conclusion themselves through games and trickery.

If interpreting this song romantically, however, the phrase “I’ll make you” could mean the narrator wants to make love with the other person.   George seems patient and unvexed about this concept “maybe, next time around.”
